page.title: 20Transport, Roads
page.content:
The embankment of the now-abandoned Arnside-Kendal railway provides a valuable barrier against flooding east of the estuary. A direct daily service to London is available from Arnside station. There are daily omnibus services to Kendal and Lancaster from the area. The absence of through road routes enhances the tranquillity of the area. The Ministry of Transport planned to construct a trunk highway to link the M6 Motorway at Carnforth with the Barrow road near Meathop Moss, crossing the Kent Estuary at Meathop Marsh. Access from this road would have affected all forms of life in the area. Following energetic opposition by residents, the Government eventually abandoned the scheme.
{GROUP:} Arnside Womens Institute
